title: Common Configuration Settings
description: Common configuration settings for this deployment

nuage_unzipped_files_dir.title: Nuage Unzip Files Directory
nuage_unzipped_files_dir.description: Full path to the directory where the Nuage unzipped files for this deployment can be found  E.g. qcow2 files. When using docker container the path needs to be a relative path from the images path specified during setup.

nuage_software_version.title: Nuage Software Version
nuage_software_version.description: Nuage software version being installed. Optional for version comparison to skip deployment of some components that have already been installed.

images_path.title: KVM Images Directory
images_path.description: Full path to the directory on the KVM target server where qcow2 files will be copied

dns_domain.title: Domain Name
dns_domain.description: Domain name for this deployment. E.g. company.net.

metro_reports_dir.title: Reports Directory
metro_reports_dir.description: Full path to the directory where the generated health reports for this deployment will be placed

branding_zip_file.title: Branding Zip File
branding_zip_file.description: Enables custom branding for the VSD GUI. When not defined, the default VSD branding, already present on the VSD itself, will be used. If branding_zip_file is defined, its value will be used to replace the default VSD branding with the contents of a zip file on the Ansible host.  The files contained in the zip file should conform to the specifications of the VNS install guide. For replacing the default branding on the VSD, this value should be set to one of the following values: 1) The path to a branding zip file on the Ansible host 2) The special value 'nuage' for adding a MetroAE tag to the default VSD branding. This value is provided as an example of a minimal modification of branding. 3) The special value 'metroae' to replace the default VSD branding with a complete MetroAE-themed brand. This value is provided as an example of a complete replacement of all branding components. Note that when this is defined the existing branding will be backed up to the directory specified by the Metro Backup Root variable under (hostname)-branding/. To rollback a branding change, copy the branding zip file out of the backup directory, set this variable to the path to the copied backup file, and run the brand_vsd playbook, i.e. metroae brand_vsd.

vsd_fqdn_global.title: Global VSD FQDN
vsd_fqdn_global.description: For clustered VSD, the XMPP FQDN for the cluster; For standalone VSD, the FQDN of the single VSD

vsd_port_global.title: Global VSD API port
vsd_port_global.description: For clustered VSD, server port on the Proxy/LB endpoint; For standalone VSD, port on the standalone instance

portal_fqdn_global.title: Global SD-WAN Portal FQDN
portal_fqdn_global.description: For HA PORTAL, the FQDN for the Proxy/LB endpoint; For standalone PORTAL, the FQDN of the single PORTAL

vstat_fqdn_global.title: Global VSTAT FQDN
vstat_fqdn_global.description: For clustered VSTAT, the FQDN for the VSTAT cluster; For standalone VSTAT, the FQDN of the single VSTAT

mgmt_bridge.title: Management Network Bridge
mgmt_bridge.description: Network Bridge used for the management interface of a component or the BOF interface on VSC. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when deploying on KVM. This field can be overridden by defining the management network bridge separately in the component configuration

data_bridge.title: Data Network Bridge
data_bridge.description: Network Bridge used for the data path of a component or the Control interface on VSC. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when deploying on KVM. This field can be overridden by defining the Data network bridge separately in the component configuration

access_bridge.title: NSGv Access Bridge
access_bridge.description: Network bridge used for the access network when installing an NSGv. This will be a Distributed Virtual PortGroup (DVPG) when deploying on vCenter or a Linux network bridge when installing on KVM

ntp_server_list.title: NTP Server IP(s)
ntp_server_list.description: List of one or more NTP server addresses that must be in dotted-decimal (IPv4) or hexidecimal (IPv6) format

dns_server_list.title: DNS server IP(s)
dns_server_list.description: List of one or more DNS server addresses for resolving component domain names. Must be in dotted-decimal (IPv4) or hexidecimal (IPv6) format.

skip_dns_resolution_tests.title: Skip DNS Resolution Tests
skip_dns_resolution_tests.description: When true, do not execute DNS resolution checks for hostnames from the MetroAE host. This is used for situations where the VSP components are configured to use a DNS server that is not accessible from the MetroAE host or when you are deploying a new DNS server with MetroAE.

prompt_before_destroy.title: Prompt before destroying components
prompt_before_destroy.description: When true, ask user for confirmation before MetroAE destroys components.

vcenter_datacenter.title: vCenter Datacenter
vcenter_datacenter.description: vCenter datacenter to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_cluster.title: vCenter Cluster Name
vcenter_cluster.description: Name of the vCenter cluster on which to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_host_reference.title: vCenter Host Reference
vcenter_host_reference.description: Requires ovftool 4.3. Reference to the host on the vCenter cluster on which to deploy Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_datastore.title: vCenter Datastore Name
vcenter_datastore.description: Name of the vCenter datastore on which to deploy the Nuage components. Can be overridden by individual components

vcenter_resource_pool.title: vCenter Resource Pool
vcenter_resource_pool.description: The vCenter resource pool where the VMs need to be located. A resource pool is a logical abstraction of resources. Different resource pools can be configured to have different priorities in case of resource contention and can have different resource reservations and limitations.

vcenter_ovftool.title: OVF tool location
vcenter_ovftool.description: This is the full path to the vCenter OVFtool executable. When running metroae from a clone of the nuage-metro repo, this should be set to the path to ovftool on the host, usually /usr/bin/ovftool. When running the metroae Docker container, the ovftool installation directory, /usr/lib/vmware-ovftool, must be copied to the metroae_data directory and this parameter must be set to the internal container path to the ovftool in that directory, /data/vmware-ovftool/ovftool.

vcenter_start_vsd_with_interfaces_disabl.title: vCenter Interfaces Disabled State
vcenter_start_vsd_with_interfaces_disabl.description: This when set to true starts the VM with disabled interfaces during upgrade process

user_ssh_pub_key.title: SSH Public Key
user_ssh_pub_key.description: Full path to the public key file to be injected into Nuage components to enable passwordless connectivity for configuration. When using docker container changing the path from default can cause connectivity issues

xmpp_tls.title: XMPP TLS
xmpp_tls.description: Flag to indicate when secure communications via TLS will be used between VSCs and VSDs

openflow_tls.title: OpenFlow TLS
openflow_tls.description: Flag to indicate when secure communications via TLS will be used between VSCs and data plane components, e.g. VRS or NSGv; If VRS is defined, target_server_password must be defined in credentials.yml

vsd_license_file.title: VSD Standard License File
vsd_license_file.description: Path to the standard license file for the VSD

vsd_cluster_license_file.title: VSD Cluster License File
vsd_cluster_license_file.description: Path to the cluster license file for the VSD

vsd_license_required_days_left.title: VSD License Required Days Left
vsd_license_required_days_left.description: Raise a failure if the VSD licenses do not have at least the specified number of days remaining before expiration. If undefined, no check of days remaining before license expiration will be made. If you want to verify that the number of days left before expiration is more than a certain number of days, uncomment this variable and set the value to the number of days.

portal_license_file.title: SD-WAN Portal License Filename
portal_license_file.description: Path to the license file for the SD-WAN Portal

nuh_license_file.title: NUH License File
nuh_license_file.description: Path to the license file for the NUH

yum_update.title: Yum update
yum_update.description: Flag to indicate whether to perform a Yum update on VSD during the installation

yum_proxy.title: Proxy for Yum Updates
yum_proxy.description: Proxy URL to be used if Yum repositories cannot be directly reached

ssh_proxy_username.title: SSH proxy configuration username
ssh_proxy_username.description: Username of the SSH proxy host if one is used

ssh_proxy_host.title: SSH proxy configuration host
ssh_proxy_host.description: IP Address or Hostname of the SSH host if one is used

vsd_fallocate_size_gb.title: KVM VSD Disk Size
vsd_fallocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VSD disk space to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vsd_fallocate_size_gb.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsc_fallocate_size_gb.title: KVM VSC Disk Size
vsc_fallocate_size_gb.description: Amount of VSC disk space to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments should not modify this value.

vsd_ram.title: KVM VSD RAM
vsd_ram.description: Amount of VSD RAM to allocate, in GB. Valid only for KVM deployments. Note: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.
vsd_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsc_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vstat_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vcin_ram.title: KVM VCIN RAM

vcin_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

portal_ram.warning: Values smaller than the default are for lab and PoC only. Production deployments must use a value greater than or equal to the default.

vsd_cpu_cores.title: KVM VSD CPU cores
vsd_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VSD. Valid only for KVM deployments

vsc_cpu_cores.title: VSC CPU cores
vsc_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VSC. Valid only for KVM deployments

vstat_cpu_cores.title: KVM VSTAT CPU cores
vstat_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VSTAT. Valid only for KVM deployments

vnsutil_cpu_cores.title: KVM VNSUTIL CPU cores
vnsutil_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VNSUTIL. Valid only for KVM deployments

nuh_cpu_cores.title: KVM NUH CPU cores
nuh_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for NUH. Valid only for KVM deployments

vcin_cpu_cores.title: KVM VCIN CPU cores
vcin_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for VCIN. Valid only for KVM deployments

portal_cpu_cores.title: KVM Portal VM CPU cores
portal_cpu_cores.description: Number of CPU's for Portal vm. Valid only for KVM deployments

vsd_auth_url.title: VSD Architect URL
vsd_auth_url.description: VSD Architect URL. Required for tasks during Upgrade, Health Checks etc

vsd_auth_enterprise.title: VSD Enterprise
vsd_auth_enterprise.description: Enterprise name used for authentication with VSD Architect. Required for tasks during Upgrade, Health Checks etc

vcin_auth_url.title: VCIN URL
vcin_auth_url.description: VCIN URL used for API interaction. Required for tasks like VRS-E upgrade (through VCIN)

vcin_auth_enterprise.title: VCIN Enterprise
vcin_auth_enterprise.description: Enterprise name used for authentication with VCIN. Required for tasks like VRS-E upgrade (through VCIN)

libnetwork_scope.title: Libnetwork scope
libnetwork_scope.description: Scope of libnetworking support; local: connectivity between containers is limited to within the local host; global: connectivity between containers may span across hosts in the cluster

libnetwork_cluster_store_scheme.title: Libnetwork cluster store URL scheme
libnetwork_cluster_store_scheme.description: Scheme portion of the URL pointing to the key-value store used for the Libnetwork cluster

libnetwork_cluster_store_host.title: Libnetwork cluster store URL host
libnetwork_cluster_store_host.description: Host portion of the URL pointing to the key-value store used for the Libnetwork cluster

libnetwork_cluster_store_port.title: Libnetwork cluster store URL port
libnetwork_cluster_store_port.description: Port portion of the URL pointing to the key-value store used for the Libnetwork cluster

vsd_skip_disk_performance_test.title: Skip VSD Disk Performance Test
vsd_skip_disk_performance_test.description: Determine whether or not to run VSD disk performance test

vsd_disk_performance_test_total_file_siz.title: Total Size of Disk Performance Test Files
vsd_disk_performance_test_total_file_siz.description: Sets the total size of created files for VSD disk performance test

vsd_disk_performance_test_minimum_thresh.title: Minimum Disk Performance Threshold
vsd_disk_performance_test_minimum_thresh.description: Sets the minimum value for VSD disk performance test
